stoke up.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to add more coal or wood to a fire
stoke up.translation[0].definitions[0].e: We kept the fire stoked up high on cold nights.
stoke up.translation[0].definitions[1].d: if something stokes up fear, anger etc, it makes a lot of people feel frightened etc
stoke up.translation[0].definitions[1].e: The leaflets stoked up fears of an invasion.
stoke up.translation[0].definitions[2].d: to eat a lot of food, for example because you will not eat again for a long time
stoke up.translation[0].definitions[2].e: We stoked up on hot soup before going out in the snow.
